snippet: Of the $540 billion in tax subsidies for housing, education, retirement and savings in 2013, the top 1 percent received more than the money received by the bottom 80 percent combined.
abstract: Spending channeled through tax code in form of credits, deductions, exemptions and the like is overwhelmingly targeted to benefit America's wealthiest tax payers; analysis by Corporation for Enterprise Development finds top 1 percent of earners in 2013 received more money back than bottom 80 percent combined; relentless pressure from Republican lawmakers has made tax code a primary driver of American social policy.
lead_paragraph: Of the $540 billion in tax subsidies for housing, education, retirement and savings in 2013, the top 1 percent received more than the money received by the bottom 80 percent combined.

headline.main: Taxes Take Away, but Also Give Back, Mostly to the Very Rich
